source.title: Salvia
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1999). Salvia. In: Walsh, N.G, Entwisle, T.J., Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae, pp. 428-430. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Lower leaves c. ovate in outline, shallowly lobed to subentire, glabrescent, not or sparsely glandular beneath; calyces often purplish; widespread
Lower leaves c. oblong in outline, pinnatifid, shortly hirsute and strongly glandular beneath; calyces green; far north-west only
